results.title: Targeting Metabolic Dysfunction for the Treatment of Mood Disorders: Review of the Evidence
results.text_hl: Current evidence is conflicting on the use of statins, @CHEMICAL_Fatty_Acids_Unsaturated @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005231 @@@polyunsaturated fatty acids@@@, @CHEMICAL_Thiazolidinediones @CHEMICAL_MESH:D045162 @@@thiazolidinediones@@@, glucagon-like peptide agonists, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, or @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ for the treatment of @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@MDD@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Bipolar_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001714 @@@BD@@@.

citations.NLM: Jones BDM, Farooqui S, Kloiber S, Husain MO, Mulsant BH, Husain MI. Targeting Metabolic Dysfunction for the Treatment of Mood Disorders: Review of the Evidence Life (Basel). 2021 Aug 11;11(8):. PMID: 34440563

results.title: Genetic insights into the effect of Metformin on psychiatry disorders.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: MR analysis results indicate a significant negative causal relationship between genetically predicted @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and Neuroticism(NEU) (OR = 0.700, 95% CI: 0.505-0.970, P = 0.032) and @<m>DISEASE_Bipolar_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001714 @@@Bipolar Disorder@@@(BID) (OR = 0.0374, 95% CI: 0.00266-0.525, P = 0.015).

citations.NLM: Zhou Q, Du Z, Lu R, Shen Y, Jiang Y, Zhu H. Genetic insights into the effect of Metformin on psychiatry disorders. Eur Arch Psychiatry Clin Neurosci. 2025 Aug;275(5):1465-1476. PMID: 40531218
citations.BibTeX: @article{40531218, title={Genetic insights into the effect of Metformin on psychiatry disorders.}, author={Zhou Q and Du Z and Lu R and Shen Y and Jiang Y and Zhu H}, journal={Eur Arch Psychiatry Clin Neurosci}, volume={275}, number={5}, pages={1465-1476}}

results.title: Risk of bipolar disorder in patients with polycystic ovary syndrome: A nationwide population-based cohort study.
results.text_hl: Also, the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ showed a significantly reduced risk of developing @<m>DISEASE_Bipolar_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001714 @@@BD@@@ compared to non-users after adjusting for the above-mentioned variables (HR: 0.36, 95% CI: 0.16-0.81).

citations.NLM: Chen SF, Yang YC, Hsu CY, Shen YC. Risk of bipolar disorder in patients with polycystic ovary syndrome: A nationwide population-based cohort study. J Affect Disord. 2020 Feb 15;263():458-462. PMID: 31969278

results.text_hl: Combined @CHEMICAL_Topiramate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077236 @@@Topiramate@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Pharmacotherapy for Second-Generation Antipsychotic-Induced Weight @DISEASE_Weight_Gain @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@Gain@@@ in Pediatric @<m>DISEASE_Bipolar_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001714 @@@Bipolar Disorder@@@ and @DISEASE_Personality_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D010554 @@@Aggression@@@.

results.title: Insulin Resistance and Blood-Brain Barrier Dysfunction Underlie Neuroprogression in Bipolar Disorder
results.text_hl: We further hypothesize that (iv) reversing @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@IR@@@ through lifestyle changes or the actions of @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ sensitizing medications such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, or optimizing BBB function using vascular protective drugs, such as @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@, could provide novel strategies for the prevention or treatment of neuroprogressive @<m>DISEASE_Bipolar_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001714 @@@BD@@@.

citations.NLM: Calkin C, McClelland C, Cairns K, Kamintsky L, Friedman A. Insulin Resistance and Blood-Brain Barrier Dysfunction Underlie Neuroprogression in Bipolar Disorder Front Psychiatry. 2021;12():636174. PMID: 34113269

results.title: Metformin for Lithium-induced Weight Gain: A Case Report
results.text_hl: We report a young male with @<m>DISEASE_Bipolar_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001714 @@@bipolar disorder@@@ who had significant @DISEASE_Weight_Gain @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@weight gain@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Lithium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008094 @@@lithium@@@, which responded to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.
